items.q: What are SEO services?
items.a: SEO services; These are professional studies that aim to increase organic visibility by optimizing the technical infrastructure, content structure and authority signals of your website according to the expectations of search engines. The aim is not just to "index the site", but to achieve sustainable visibility in the right words, in front of the right audience.

items.q: What does an SEO agency do?
items.a:
SEO agency;
  • Analyzes the current situation (technical + content + authority),
  • Deduces keyword and content strategy,
  • Plans technical and content improvements,
  • Works with your IT and content teams if necessary,
  • Follows the results through KPIs and reports throughout the process.
DGTLFACE builds this with a customized architecture especially for hotel & tourism, e-commerce and corporate sites.

items.q: What is the difference between technical SEO and content SEO?
items.a:
• Technical SEO: Site speed, mobile compatibility, crawlability, HTTP statuses, URL structure, site maps, schema, etc. focuses on infrastructure issues.
  • Content SEO: It determines which topics, with which keywords, and with what depth of content you should be present; It shapes page contents, titles and information architecture.
In a successful SEO project, both layers should be considered together.

items.q: How to do SEO for hotels?
items.a:
In hotel projects, SEO is designed by taking into account
  • destination + concept + brand triangle,
  • number of rooms and season dynamics,
  • OTA and direct booking balance
. General approach:
  • Destination and concept-based keyword maps,
  • Page layouts for room types, concepts and amenities,
  • Visibility at the "research" stage with blog and FAQ contents,
  • Harmonization of technical infrastructure with hotel reservation systems.
hotel digital marketing →

items.q: Is SEO required only for hotels or for e-commerce and corporate sites as well?
items.a: SEO; Although it has different dynamics for hotel & tourism, e-commerce and corporate sites, it is one of the most important sources of organic traffic in all sectors. In many industries, more than 50% of total organic traffic comes from keywords covered by SEO efforts; so it's critical for long-term visibility.

items.q: How long does it take to get results on Google with SEO?
items.a:
This period; It varies depending on the sector, competition, current situation and scope of work. In general:
  • 1–3 months: first signals and signs of improvement,
  • 3–6 months: significant traffic and visibility increase,
  • 6–12 months: strong and permanent effect.
If aggressive results are aimed in the short term, it is recommended to establish a parallel model with SEM (Google Ads) as well as SEO.

items.q: Can SEO replace advertising budget?
items.a: Over time, SEO creates a powerful source of traffic with no cost per click; However, it is healthier not to replace the advertising budget completely, but to establish a balanced structure with it. Advert; While SEO provides short-term visibility and testing, medium-long-term permanent traffic and brand authority.

items.q: Can I be successful just by writing content without getting SEO services?
items.a: Quality content is important; However, if the technical infrastructure, keyword strategy and authority signals are not established properly, your content may not reach the visibility it deserves. Content production must be considered together with strategy and technical background.

items.q: Is SEO service a one-time effort or should it be continuous?
items.a: SEO; Algorithm updates should be treated as a continuous process due to competitor movements and content dynamics. One-time technical fixes are helpful, but sustainable visibility requires regular analysis, content creation and optimization.

items.q: What kind of goals make sense to set with SEO?
items.a:
• Setting business-oriented targets such as organic traffic volume and quality (region, device, source)
  • Visibility in target keywords
  • Number of reservations/sales/leads from organic sources
  • Share of organic channel in total revenue
is more meaningful than just position- or impression-oriented targets.

items.q: What are SEO services, in short?
items.a: SEO services are professional work done on the technical and content side to make your website more visible and findable in search engines.

items.q: Where should I start with SEO for my hotel?
items.a: First, the technical status and destination-based visibility of your current site are analyzed; Then, keyword and content maps are created according to the destination + concept + brand trio.

items.q: How long does it take to get results on Google with SEO?
items.a: You usually start to see significant signals within 3–6 months and permanent effects within 6–12 months; This period varies depending on the competition and the current situation.

items.q: Is SEO necessary for everyone?
items.a: Yes; In any industry where leads come from search engines, SEO is a critical requirement for long-term visibility.

items.q: Should the agency or the IT team do technical SEO?
items.a: Technical planning and prioritization is done by the agency, and implementation is often done with your IT team; This is the healthy model.

items.q: Will the results disappear after the SEO work is completed?
items.a: The effect of a properly structured SEO work continues; However, if maintenance and updates are not carried out due to competition, new content and algorithm changes, it may weaken over time.

section3.title: SEO Service Scope, Process & Operation Questions

items.q: What are the main components of your SEO service package?
items.a:
General structure:
  • SEO audit (technical + content + authority analysis),
  • Keyword and content strategy,
  • Plan for technical SEO improvements,
  • In-page optimization (title, meta, heading, content structure),
  • Content production / revision (blog, FAQ, destination pages, etc.),
  • Local SEO (Google Business Profile, map and comment management),
  • Reporting and regular optimization.
(→ SEO , Technical SEO , Content SEO)

items.q: What do you analyze before starting the SEO process?
items.a:
• Current organic traffic and keyword visibility,
  • Your competitors' SEO status,
  • Technical infrastructure of the site (speed, mobile, crawlability),
  • Content architecture and URL structure,
  • Backlink profile and authority signals
are examined in detail. Accordingly, a realistic target and time plan is drawn up for the project.

items.q: Who has the responsibility for technical SEO: the agency or the IT team?
items.a:
On the technical SEO side:
  • Analysis, prioritization and task list: DGTLFACE
  • Implementation (code, server, CMS settings): most often your IT team or web agency
  • Control and testing: together
A hybrid model is recommended. Thus, both your internal resources are evaluated and the technical side is managed with the "SEO lens".

items.q: Who writes content for content SEO?
items.a:
Two models are possible:
  • The content is completely prepared by DGTLFACE and sent to you for approval.
  • Your internal team writes, DGTLFACE does the editing and SEO adaptation.
Especially in hotel and corporate projects, the hybrid model, which will get the field information from you and the SEO framework from us, works very efficiently.

items.q: Why is local SEO important for hotels and service businesses?
items.a:
For physically located businesses such as hotels, restaurants, clinics, educational institutions, a significant portion of users make decisions based on maps and local results. Therefore:
  • Google Business Profile management,
  • comment and score management,
  • address and NAP consistency
are critical parts of local SEO. (→ Local SEO )

items.q: Is there a minimum working time for SEO services?
items.a: We generally recommend study periods of 6–12 months. Shorter-term “audit + roadmap” projects are also possible; However, for a permanent effect, at least 6 months should be targeted.

items.q: How does the weekly/monthly process work in an SEO project?
items.a:
• First month: Audit, strategy, prioritization, basic technical fixes,
  • 2–3. month: Content and page optimizations, early signals,
  • 4–6. month: Deepened content, authority studies,
  • After: Regular reporting, optimization and new opportunity areas.
At the end of each month, progress and priorities for the next month are clearly shared.

items.q: Can SEO service and SEM (Google Ads) service be carried out together?
items.a: Yes, in fact, this is the healthiest model for most projects. SEO gives you organic visibility, while SEM gives you short-term traffic and testing. When the data and learnings of the two channels are used together, the entire digital strategy is on stronger ground. (→ SEM , Google Ads Management )

items.q: What metrics do you measure SEO success with?
items.a:
• Metrics such as organic traffic volume and quality (country, device, behavior),
  • Visibility and click rate in target keywords,
  • Number of reservations/sales/leads from organic sources,
  • Share of organic channel in total revenue,
  • Single page / content-based performance
are clearly tracked in monthly reports. (→ Seo Reporting )

items.q: I invested in SEO, but visibility does not increase; Where could the problem be?
items.a:
This situation is usually caused by a combination of factors such as:
  • inadequate or disorganized content strategy,
  • technical obstacles (crawl problems, slowness, misdirections),
  • poor internal link structure,
  • lack of competitive analysis
. First of all, it is necessary to conduct a comprehensive SEO audit and update the road map based on this analysis.

items.q: Organic traffic is increasing, but sales or bookings are not increasing; is this normal?
items.a:
Traffic increase alone may not exactly align with business goals. It must be examined whether the incoming traffic:
  • is coming from the right countries/segments,
  • whether it lands on the right pages,
  • whether the web experience and the reservation/checkout process supports the user
. SEO strategy should be designed focusing on conversion quality, not just traffic.

items.q: What problems does choosing the wrong SEO service cause?
items.a:
• Risky structures based solely on buying links,
  • Production of content unrelated to the real commercial goals of the hotel/brand,
  • Ignoring "invisible but critical" errors on the technical side
may damage the domain authority in the long run and may even result in penalties. That's why transparent reporting, clear methodology and industry alignment are important when choosing an SEO service.

items.q: What are the most common mistakes in SEO?
items.a:
• Thinking that you have solved everything with a one-page "general SEO study",
  • Neglecting the technical side by just blogging,
  • Producing duplicate or very weak content,
  • Wrong URL and redirect structures,
  • Aggressive but poor quality backlink work.
These mistakes; Although it may seem like a short-term gain, it can lead to loss of visibility and reputation in the long term.

items.q: Is it guaranteed to leave my competitors behind with SEO?
items.a: The term “guarantee” is not ethical for any SEO work. However, gaining competitive advantage and sustainable growth is possible with the right strategy, regular implementation and accurate metric tracking.

items.q: How should the return on SEO services budget be interpreted?
items.a:
SEO investment is not measured in the short term as much as advertising, but it produces a cumulative effect in the medium to long term. Generally, ROI evaluation is made in the 6-12 month period based on the organic channel's:
  • share in revenue,
  • cost per conversion,
  • total visibility
.

items.q: Does SEO also affect the performance of other channels?
items.a:
Yes. A well-designed SEO architecture also positively affects:
  • landing page quality of advertising campaigns,
  • performance of pages directed by social media shares,
  • conversion rates of e-mail and remarketing campaigns
. SEO often acts as the information architecture of the entire digital structure.

items.q: How does your SEO strategy differ for Türkiye in general and tourism regions?

Antalya, Belek, Bodrum, Side etc. In regions, separate content and keyword sets are defined according to destination + concept + season dynamics.

items.q: Why is hotel SEO critical in Antalya and tourism regions?
items.a:
In these regions, users often make searches focused on:
  • destination + hotel type,
  • concept (all inclusive, adults only, family, etc.),
  • activity and experience
. Therefore, it is critical for the hotel website to be visible in these combinations to reduce OTA dependence and increase direct booking.

items.q: What is your SEO approach for e-commerce sites?
items.a:
On the e-commerce side:
  • category and filter structures,
  • product detail pages,
  • in-site search and facet structures,
  • blog/guide contents
are at the center of SEO architecture. The aim is to take the user to the right product group in the shortest way and strengthen the cart process.

items.q: What does SEO bring to corporate sites and B2B projects?
items.a: SEO in corporate and B2B projects; It is important in terms of brand awareness, sectoral authority and qualified lead generation. Particularly for niche products and services, being visible in searches made by users "looking for solutions" increases the quality and efficiency of the sales team.

items.q: How should SEO be designed for hotels and brands that want to expand into the international market?
items.a: Multilingual structures, country-based domain/subdirectory preferences, local search dynamics and competitive analysis should be considered together. English, German, Russian etc. In different languages, separate strategies are developed based on both destination and concept.

section6.title: Mini SEO FAQ

items.q: Is SEO alone enough or is advertising necessary?
items.a: SEO produces medium-long term results, advertising produces short term results; It gives the best effect when used together.

items.q: Can I get higher in SEO just by blogging?
items.a: A blog is important but not enough on its own; Without technical and on-page optimization, blogs cannot reach their full potential.

items.q: Do I have to change my design when I have SEO work done?
items.a: Not always; but in some cases, UX and design change significantly improves SEO performance.

items.q: Does it make sense to only do technical SEO and leave the content side blank?
items.a: No. Even if the technical infrastructure is good, permanent visibility cannot be achieved without comprehensive and correctly constructed content.

items.q: Do I have to produce new content every week for SEO?
items.a: It's not the quantity that matters, but the right topics and sufficient depth. Sometimes updating existing content is more effective than writing new content.

items.q: Do backlinks still matter?
items.a: Yes, but quality and natural structure are more critical than ever. It is necessary to stay away from short-term, aggressive link purchasing models. (→ /Services/seo/backlinkSeo)

items.q: Does SEO work slow down my website?
items.a: Conversely, an important part of technical SEO is speeding up the site and improving the user experience.

items.q: Will I have to change CMS for SEO?
items.a: In most cases, it is possible to move forward by making improvements to the existing CMS; However, if there is a very limited or problematic structure, platform change may come to the fore in the long term.

items.q: Can I also receive SEO service as a short analysis and roadmap study?
items.a: Yes. With just the “analysis + roadmap” project, a plan can be prepared that you can then implement with your internal team.

items.q: How often is this SEO FAQ content updated?
items.a: It is planned to be reviewed at least every 90 days when there is a significant change in Google algorithm updates, SEO service scope, or targeted industry/productive search set.

generalQuestions.title: General Questions About Social Media Management

items.q: What is social media management?
items.a: Social media management; It covers the entire strategy, content production, sharing, interaction and reporting processes that enable the brand to exist with a consistent identity and message on channels such as Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, YouTube and LinkedIn. The aim is not just to "post"; is to build a solid bridge between brand perception, community and business goals.

items.q: What does professional social media management do?
items.a:
Professional social media management;
  • Tells the brand's story accurately,
  • Establishes regular and meaningful communication with the target audience,
  • Transfers traffic to the website and reservation/sales channels with a combination of content and advertising,
  • Manages campaigns and periodic communications in a planned manner,
  • Supports decision processes by reporting performance regularly.
Thus, social media is no longer just a field of "likes"; It becomes a measurable growth tool.

items.q: Is social media management necessary for all brands?
items.a: Social media management is critical for every brand whose target audience is digitally active. Especially in hotel & tourism and lifestyle brands; The majority of users definitely check their social media profiles and content during the decision process. Therefore, a professional social media presence is decisive in terms of trust and preference.

items.q: Is social media management just “content sharing”?
items.a:
No. Social media management is a process in which many components work together, such as
  • Strategy and content plan,
  • Image/video production,
  • Text writing,
  • Community and message management,
  • Advertising and targeting,
  • Analysis and reporting
. Just “posting” does not represent this whole.

items.q: Why is social media so important for hotels?
items.a:
Choosing a hotel is not a completely rational decision; Experience, atmosphere and sense of trust play a very strong role. Guests; He often reviews the hotel's room, pool, food, atmosphere and guest comments on social media. For this reason, hotel social media;
  • Visualizes the concept and experience,
  • Announces seasons, campaigns and events,
  • Creates a strong channel for direct booking and communication.
(→ /tr/otel-digital-marketing)

items.q: For which brands other than hotels is the SMM service suitable?
items.a:
Social media management can be applied to many areas such as
  • Hotel & tourism businesses,
  • Lifestyle and fashion brands,
  • Food, health, education, beauty sectors,
  • B2B brands (especially focusing on LinkedIn)
. The strategy is tailored to the industry and target audience.

items.q: Is it enough to move forward with just SEO and advertising without social media?
items.a: SEO and advertising are important; but social media fills a critical gap, especially on the side of perception, trust, and community. After seeing the brand through search or advertising, the user often comes to social media and makes a decision by "feeling the brand". Therefore, social media is the layer that reinforces the decision.

items.q: How does SMM affect brand identity?
items.a:
A consistent and professional social media management makes the brand identity visible in daily life through
  • tone of voice,
  • visual style,
  • content topics,
  • brand values
. Especially in hotels and lifestyle brands, social media is often the true showcase of the brand.

items.q: What does the concept of “community” mean with social media management?
items.a: Community; It does not only mean the number of followers, but also the people who regularly interact with the brand, produce and share content. Community management; It is about professionally managing comments, messages, tags and DMs and making the guest/customer feel "heard".

items.q: How should social media management and PR or content agencies be positioned?
items.a:
For some brands, PR, content and social media services are carried out by different agencies. The important thing here is that
  • content calendars,
  • messages and campaigns,
  • crisis and comment management
do not conflict with each other and are combined under a single strategy. DGTLFACE; Within this structure, it can undertake the "digital and performance-oriented social media" pillar.

items.q: What is social media management, in short?
items.a: Planning how your brand appears on social media, what it says and how it talks to whom; It is the entire content, sharing, interaction and reporting processes.

items.q: Where should I start with social media management for my hotel?
items.a: Existing accounts are analyzed, target markets and season targets are clarified; Then, a content and sharing plan appropriate to the concept and destination is prepared.

items.q: Is it possible to increase bookings or sales with social media?
items.a: Yes; With the right content, the right campaign and the right guidance, social media can make a meaningful contribution to the reservation and sales process.

items.q: Which is better, an agency or an internal team?
items.a: The internal team knows the brand very well; The agency brings expertise in strategy, production and performance. The most efficient model is often a hybrid structure.

items.q: What is the minimum time for social media management?
items.a: Generally, periods of 3–6 months are healthier to see the results of the strategy and make optimizations.

items.q: Can social media management be carried out on a single platform?
items.a: Initially, 1–2 priority platforms can be selected; However, in the medium to long term, it is more effective to create a combination of platforms according to your target audience and industry.

items.q: How is the monthly content plan prepared?

are taken into consideration. Plan; It is designed with a balanced distribution according to content types (informative, experience, campaign, social proof, etc.). (→ /Services/smm/socialMediaPlanning)

items.q: Which formats take priority: feed, story, Reels, TikTok, YouTube?
items.a:
This varies depending on the brand's industry and target audience; but generally:

  • Story: Daily communication, campaign and instant content,
  • Reels/TikTok: Discovery and access,
  • YouTube: Used for deep storytelling and experience

items.q: How do you maintain brand identity in social media designs?

items.q: How to manage multilingual social media?

items.q: How often should Story and Reels content be shared?

The important thing here is not to "post something every day", but to share regularly and in a quality that reflects the brand.

items.q: How do you evaluate user-generated content (UGC)?
items.a:
UGC, especially for hotels and lifestyle brands; It is the most natural form of trust. With the right permission processes:

  • UGC can be promoted in campaigns (e.g. hashtag contests).
UGC management is a valuable tool for connecting with the community.

items.q: Does it include not only “sharing” but also message and comment management?

items.q: Does your SMM service also produce advertising creatives and copy?

items.q: How do internal team + DGTLFACE work together?
items.a:
• Internal team: Takes on the role of brand insight, stock content production, fast-field photography/video, campaign briefs,
  • DGTLFACE: Strategy, planning, design, copy, reporting and optimization
. Thus, your internal resources are used with maximum efficiency and the process is managed professionally.

items.q: How is SMM integrated with the overall digital strategy?
items.a:
Social media strategy; It is designed to be compatible with SEO, SEM, web, OTA and call center. For example:
  • Campaign messages,
  • destination and product focuses,
  • offer and pricing language
are planned to be consistent across all channels. (→ /Services/sem, /tr/otel-digital-marketing)

items.q: How does your social media role change during campaign periods?
items.a:
During campaign periods:
  • Teaser content,
  • campaign launch shares,
  • last day reminder content,
  • post-campaign summary and social proof content
all processes of the campaign are supported via social media. Advertising and organic content are planned together.

items.q: What are your contract and time expectations for SMM services?
items.a: 6-month or 12-month contracts are generally recommended. However, shorter “pilot periods” can also be planned for some brands. The important thing is; The goal, scope and KPIs are clear throughout the process.

items.q: Is crisis or negative comments management included in the SMM service?
items.a: Yes, within certain limits, crisis and negative comment management also falls within the scope of social media management. It is recommended to work in coordination with PR teams on larger crisis and reputation management issues.

section5.title: Performance, Engagement and Return on Investment

items.q: How do you measure social media success?
items.a:
Social media performance is not just measured by the number of likes. Generally:
  • Access and impressions,
  • Interaction rate (like, comment, sharing, saving),
  • Follower quality and growth rate,
  • Redirection to website and reservation/sales channels,
  • Forms, messages and phone calls,
  • Conversion metrics in advertising campaigns
are tracked.(→ /Services/smm/socialMediaReporting)

items.q: Does social media really contribute to bookings or sales?
items.a: Yes. A significant portion of users double-check the brand with social media content before making a purchase or reservation decision. With the right guidance (link, button, campaign, DM, WhatsApp, etc.), social media can become the decision-reinforcing and triggering layer of the reservation and sales process.

items.q: Only likes come, but no sales; where is the problem?
items.a:
This situation is usually caused by factors such as:
  • content appealing to the wrong audience,
  • shares that are only aesthetic but do not contain “offers”,
  • inadequate call-to-action,
  • poor web/landing experience
. Social media strategy should be reconstructed considering both perception and conversion targets.

items.q: I'm having a low engagement problem; How do you handle it?
items.a:
Low engagement is associated with
  • incorrect content topics,
  • inappropriate formats for the platform,
  • poor visual and text editing,
  • lack of community management
. First step; is to analyze the content mix, broadcast hours and target audience. Interaction is then optimized through the test–learn cycle.

items.q: Is it enough to share only during campaign periods?
items.a: No. Being active only during the campaign period creates a "only sales-oriented" perception in the eyes of the user. A healthy social media management requires content that adds value and builds relationships even during non-campaign periods.

items.q: What should be the relationship between social media ads and organic content?
items.a:
Organic content strengthens brand perception, and advertisements strengthen reach and conversion. The healthiest structure is designed as
  • supporting well-performing organic content with advertising,
  • seeing campaign messages both on the organic and advertising side,
  • nurturing organic traffic with remarketing and special target audiences
.

items.q: How should I evaluate the return on the budget I allocate for social media?
items.a:
Social media investment should be evaluated in terms of both brand value and conversion:
  • Access and interaction quality,
  • Website and reservation/sales referrals,
  • ROAS/CPA values ​​of advertising campaigns,
  • Long-term community and brand perception
should be considered together.

items.q: Does social media affect the performance of other digital channels?
items.a:
Yes. A well-designed social media presence positively affects
  • click and conversion rates of advertising campaigns,
  • brand searches,
  • performance of e-mail and remarketing campaigns
. The decision is made easier when the user sees the brand across multiple touchpoints.

section6.title: Productive Search & Industry-Focused Social Media Questions

items.q: How does your social media strategy differ for Türkiye in general and tourism regions?
items.a: While planning content that appeals to wider audiences in Türkiye-wide communication; In tourism regions, destination, season and market dynamics come to the fore. For example, seasonal campaigns, events and experience content are concentrated in regions such as Antalya, Belek and Kemer.

items.q: Why is hotel social media critical in Antalya and tourism regions?
items.a:
In these destinations, guests; It looks at not only the room and price of the hotel, but also the atmosphere, experience and comments. Social media plays a decisive role in the decision process as it brings
  • real images of the hotel,
  • guest experiences,
  • events and activities
to daily life.

items.q: How should social media be structured for hotels working in the foreign market?
items.a:
For hotels working in the foreign market:
  • Language and cultural compatibility,
  • content plan according to target countries,
  • campaign setups according to seasons and holiday periods
are important. English, German, Russian etc. Content across languages ​​should be tailored to market-based expectations.

items.q: What is your approach to social media for lifestyle brands?
items.a:
In lifestyle brands;
  • storytelling,
  • aesthetic visual language,
  • influencer and UGC integration,
  • community and trend following
come to the fore. Here, establishing and maintaining the "brand world" is as important as sales.

items.q: Do you establish relationships between SMM and OTAs or booking platforms?
items.a: Yes. In hotel projects; Social media communication can be designed to be compatible with OTA comments and campaigns as well as web and direct booking. Consistency of the same concept and campaign messages on OTA, web and social media accelerates the guest's decision process.

items.q: Does social media management only mean Instagram?
items.a: No; Instagram is important but not the only platform. Channels such as Facebook, TikTok, YouTube and LinkedIn should also be evaluated depending on the target audience.

items.q: Is it right to share the same content on all platforms?
items.a: The dynamics of each platform are different; The essence of the content may remain the same, but the format and narrative must be adapted according to the platform.

items.q: Do I have to post every day?
items.a: You don't have to; What is important is regular and strategic sharing. 3 quality content per week is worth more than 7 random posts per day.

items.q: Should all content be professionally shot?
items.a: Professional shots are important; However, correctly edited mobile shots and real moments are also very valuable for the community.

items.q: Can social media be managed using only influencers?
items.a: Influencers can be supportive; However, without a strong content and strategy in the brand's own account, the lasting impact will be limited.

items.q: Is returning late to comments and DMs a problem?
items.a: Yes; Especially in hotels and service businesses, users expect quick responses. A late response can often turn into a “choice of another brand”.

items.q: Can I proceed with just advertising without organic content?
items.a: Ads provide visibility; However, if the user encounters a blank or poor view when they enter your profile, trust is damaged. Organic and advertising should be considered together.

items.q: Is a social media account focused solely on likes enough?
items.a: Likes alone are not an indicator of success. What really matters is; It is the contribution of content to business goals, web traffic and reservations/sales.

items.q: Can I also take social media management as a short consultancy project?
items.a: Yes. With consultancy projects that only include analysis + roadmap + content plan, you can carry out the implementation with your own team.

items.q: How often should this SMM FAQ content be updated?
items.a: When there are changes in social platform algorithms, formats (e.g. Reels/TikTok weighting) and DGTLFACE's SMM service scope or target sectors; It is recommended to review it at least every 90 days.

It is sufficient to share a brief brief about your brand or hotel:
  • website and social account links,

. DGTLFACE team; Prepares a proposal and road map including scope, duration and budget framework. (Primary CTA: Get a quote for Social Media Management → /Services/smm)

items.a: Instead of buying a ready-made package; It means discussing your specific social media architecture based on your brand, goals and current situation. This meeting is critical to understand market and seasonal dynamics, especially in hotel and tourism projects.

items.a: Yes. Such comprehensive FAQ pages; It helps your brand be more visible in search results for service keywords such as “social media management”. Additionally, with properly structured data, some questions can also be displayed as question and answer boxes in search results.

items.q: Can social media FAQ content also be used in social media posts?
items.a:
Yes. The questions and answers here can be considered as a content source for
  • carousel,

. In this way, a consistent information architecture is established between the web and social media.

generalQuestions.title: General Questions About Web & Software Services

items.q: What are web & software services?
items.a: Web & software services; It means the design, development and sustainable management of your brand's corporate website, reservation/application infrastructure and integrations with other digital systems (PMS, OTA, CRM, payment, analytics, etc.). In other words, it is not just about "making a site", it is about establishing a working digital infrastructure.

items.q: What is the difference between a corporate website and a “ready site”?
items.a:
Ready-made site solutions may work for certain situations; but are generally limited in terms of:
  • performance and speed,
  • mobile experience,
  • SEO and content flexibility,
  • special integration needs,
  • security and KVKK compliance
. A corporate website is designed and developed specifically for your brand's goals, industry and integration needs.

items.q: What is critical in the web & software infrastructure for hotels?
items.a:
In hotel projects:
  • fast and mobile compatible web,
  • net room/concept presentation,
  • reservation engine integration,
  • PMS-OTA connections,
  • multilingual structure,
  • security and KVKK compliance
are critical topics. The web & software side is of particular importance as it is the gateway to the digital booking process. (→ /tr/otel-digital-marketing)

items.q: Who are web & software services suitable for?
items.a:
• Hotel and tourism businesses,
  • Corporate companies,
  • Service-oriented B2B brands,
  • Appointment/application-oriented businesses such as health and education
A professional web & software infrastructure is required. Especially for businesses that invest in activities such as SEO, advertising and social media, it is essential that the infrastructure be at a level that can support these investments.

items.q: What does “performance-oriented” web infrastructure mean?
items.a:
Performance-oriented web infrastructure is an infrastructure that meets criteria such as
  • opening times of less than 3 seconds,
  • acceptable levels in Core Web Vitals (Core Web Performance Metrics) metrics,
  • seamless experience on mobile,
  • clean code and optimized visuals,
  • stable and scalable server infrastructure
. Since 53% of users abandon sites that open in more than 3 seconds, infrastructure performance directly affects revenue and bookings.

items.q: Is it possible to improve the existing infrastructure instead of building a new site?
items.a:
In most cases yes. Your existing infrastructure is examined;
  • basic performance problems,
  • technical obstacles,
  • content architecture problems,
  • integration deficiencies
are identified. While improvement may be sufficient in some projects, in some cases “trying to improve the old” may be more costly and risky than doing a new project. The decision should be made after detailed analysis.

items.q: How long does a web & software project take?
items.a:
Duration; varies depending on the scope of the project:
  • Simple corporate site: 4–8 weeks,
  • Multilingual hotel site with reservation infrastructure: 8–16 weeks,
  • Projects with special integration or panel development: longer.
The important thing here is not to rush the design, development, integration and testing processes.

items.q: On the web & software side, which one-time project or continuous service makes more sense?
items.a:
Even though the infrastructure is established once, there is a need for continuous maintenance and development due to
  • new integration needs,
  • security updates,
  • performance optimizations,
  • content & design updates
. That's why a one-time launch + ongoing maintenance/support model is best for most projects.

items.q: Why is the combination of “internal IT team + external software partner” recommended?
items.a: Your IT team; He knows the internal processes and operations very well, and sees the relationship of the infrastructure with other systems of the company better. The external software partner is; Brings expertise on web technologies, performance, security, UX and integration. The model where two parties work together is advantageous in terms of both flexibility and quality.

items.q: How does web & software infrastructure affect SEO and advertising performance?
items.a:
Infrastructure; SEO is the backbone of advertising and social media performance. A site that is slow, mobile-incompatible or has technical problems will lead to:
  • loss of visibility in SEO,
  • high cost per click and low conversion in advertising campaigns,
  • loss of social media traffic on the site
. Therefore, the web & software side should be considered together with marketing investments.

items.q: What are web & software services, in short?
items.a: It is the professional design, development and management of your brand's website, reservation/application infrastructure and integrations.

items.q: Where should I start with the new website for my hotel?
items.a: First, the current situation and needs are analyzed; Then, site architecture and technology are selected according to concept, destination, reservation structure and integration needs.

items.q: How do I integrate the reservation infrastructure into the site?
items.a: The PMS/booking system you use is determined; Depending on the integration method offered by the provider (widget, API, iframe, etc.), the web infrastructure is configured accordingly.

items.q: What should the performance-oriented web infrastructure be like?
items.a: Fast, mobile compatible, clean coded, works with optimized visuals; There must be an infrastructure that complies with CWV metrics and security standards.

items.q: Are web & software services necessary for everyone?
items.a: A professional web & software infrastructure is critical for every brand that gains customers and manages its reputation digitally.

items.q: Would it be enough in the long run to just use a ready-made website?
items.a: For small and simple projects, some time may be sufficient; However, as integration, performance and scalability needs increase, custom solutions become inevitable.

section3.title: Corporate Websites & Scope of Service

items.q: What does your web & software service package include?
items.a:
• Needs analysis and information architecture
  • UX/UI design
  • Frontend and backend development
  • CMS selection and installation
  • Reservation/application and other integrations
  • Testing, security and performance optimization
  • Launch and post-launch maintenance/support
(→ /tr/web-and-software-services, /Services/software/websiteAndSoftware)

items.q: How should the corporate website be?
items.a:
• Design that reflects the brand clearly and professionally
  • Fast and mobile-friendly infrastructure
  • Clear content hierarchy and powerful navigation
  • Structure compatible with SEO-analytics-security trio
  • An easily manageable panel
It is essential to be a useful showcase, not "just to look stylish".

items.q: How to establish high-performance web infrastructure for hotels?
items.a:
• Destination and concept pages
  • Room types and photo/video presentation
  • Reservation engine integration
  • Multilingual structure
  • Mobile fast booking experience
On the server and caching side, a structure should be established to carry the heavy traffic during the tourism season.

items.q: Is it necessary to use CMS or is a custom panel better?
items.a:
• If your content and page changing needs are high, a well-structured CMS is a great advantage.
  • If there are very specific workflows and integrations, the need for a project-based special panel may arise.
In most corporate and hotel projects, a correctly configured modern CMS is sufficient and flexible. (→ /Services/software/cmsInstallationService)

items.q: What does KVKK compliant web & software infrastructure mean?
items.a:
• Minimization of data collected in form and reservation areas
  • Cookie and permission management
  • Logging and access controls
  • Necessary information texts and policies
This means correct design of these headings both technically and legally. (→ /Services/software/kvkk)

items.q: What are you doing on the security side?
items.a:
• SSL/TLS obligation
  • Security patches and updates
  • Intrusion detection and protection layers (WAF, etc.)
  • Backup strategies
  • Authority and access management
Security is a mandatory standard, especially in structures with reservation and payment processes. (→ /Services/software/serverManagementService)

items.q: How does web & software infrastructure impact analytics and reporting?
items.a:
• Proper operation of GA4, Tag Manager and other analytical tools
  • Correct conversion and revenue tracking
  • Clear visibility of channel-based performance
Improperly constructed infrastructures create “dark areas” on the data side.

items.q: Can the infrastructure remain resilient if integration requirements increase?
items.a: If the project is designed based on the principle of scalability from the very beginning, new integrations (CRM, payment, marketing automation, new PMS, etc.) can be added with less risk and cost. Architecture should consider not only the present but also the future.

items.q: Is web & software service provided only for new projects, do you also touch existing systems?
items.a:
• New projects from scratch
  • Improvement and reconstruction in the existing structure
  • Mini projects focused only on integration and performance
The decision is made together according to your business goals and the status of your existing infrastructure.

items.q: What do you analyze before starting a web & software project?
items.a:
• Current website (if any) and performance
  • Business goals and usage scenarios
  • Integration needs (PMS, OTA, CRM, payment, analytics, etc.)
  • Content structure and information architecture
  • Technical and security status
As a result of these analyses, a realistic scope, time and budget framework for the project is derived.

items.q: What stages do we go through during the project?
items.a:
1. Analysis and discovery meetings
  2. Information architecture and UX design
  3. UI design
  4. Development (frontend + backend)
  5. Integrations and testing
  6. Performance and security optimization
  7. Training and launch
  8. Maintenance and support process
Each stage has clear deliverables and feedback loops.

items.q: How much time do our internal teams have to devote to this process?
items.a: The most intense need is in the initial information gathering and decision-making stages. Periodic checks and approvals are required during the subsequent design and development process. In a well-structured project, your internal teams' time is used efficiently; operational load is kept to a minimum.

items.q: How are project management and communication carried out?
items.a: A responsible person is assigned to each project; You work with one main contact person. Communication; It is carried out via e-mail, project management tools and periodic meetings. Critical decision points are planned in advance; surprises are reduced to a minimum.

items.q: What is offered during the maintenance & support process?
items.a:
• Security updates
  • Minor improvements and fixes
  • Performance checks
  • Going live of new features from time to time
Support for content and new modules can be handled in separate scopes.(→ /Services/software/websiteMaintanceService)

items.q: How do you communicate technically with our IT team?
items.a:
We communicate directly with IT teams in technical language on
  • Technology selection
  • Server architecture
  • Integration points
. While the management side receives business and goal-oriented information, the IT team can see technical details clearly.

items.q: After the web & software project is completed, do you want to "let go" or do you prefer a long-term partnership?
items.a: One-off projects are possible; However, our approach is to think of the web & software side as a long-term business partner. In this way, it becomes easier to progress in new integrations and developments with teams that know the same architecture.

items.q: My site is very slow; Is this just server related?
items.a:
• Large and unoptimized images
  • Unnecessary scripts and plugins
  • Weak caching structure
  • Heavy theme and code structure
  • Insufficient server resources
Slowness is usually caused by a combination of these factors. Performance optimization should cover both the code and server side.

items.q: The site experience on mobile is very poor; Where should I start?
items.a:
• Reviewing the responsive structure
  • Simplifying the menu and navigation
  • Visual and font optimization
  • Shortening the mobile form and reservation processes
First, mobile user data and behavior flows are examined. Mobile is no longer an additional channel, but the primary platform.

items.q: Could the low conversion rate (form/booking) be related to infrastructure?
items.a:
• Page speed
  • Number of form and booking steps
  • Trust elements (comment, badge, SSL, payment trust)
  • Clarity and readability of the design
These factors directly affect the conversion rate. It is necessary to examine not only the ads, but also the page and flow design.

items.q: The administration panel is very complex; is this normal?
items.a:
• According to daily usage scenarios
  • According to the content and module responsibles
  • The panel should be designed by eliminating unnecessary areas
. An unusable panel makes the site unupdatable in the long run.

items.q: What is your approach to security vulnerabilities and hacking risks?
items.a: Our approach is not to intervene after a problem occurs; is preventive security. Without regular patching, access control, logging and backup, the risk is unacceptable, especially on sites with hotel and reservation infrastructure.

items.q: Why are unplanned maintenance costs increasing so much?
items.a:
• The code becomes more complex
  • The chain of errors increases
  • Every new change becomes risky and expensive
Every quick solution made without a plan and documentation creates higher costs in the long run.

items.q: Is it necessary to completely renew a site that uses old technology?
items.a:
• Technologies with outdated update support
  • Infrastructures that cannot meet modern integration needs
  • For structures that fall far behind performance and security standards
redevelopment is often healthier and more economical in the long run.

items.q: How do improvements on the web & software side affect the performance of other digital channels?
items.a:
• SEO visibility
  • Conversion rates in advertising campaigns
  • The value of traffic from social media and email campaigns
directly increases. Improvements made on the web & software side increase the ROI of your entire digital budget.

section6.title: Productive Search & Industry-Focused Web & Software Questions

items.q: How should the web infrastructure be designed for hotel and tourism businesses across Türkiye?
items.a:
• Multilingual structure
  • Destination and concept pages
  • Mobile-oriented reservation processes
  • Integrations compatible with OTA and call center
In hotels throughout Turkey, architecture should be designed for different destinations and markets, taking these topics into consideration.

items.q: Why is web performance critical in destinations such as Antalya, Belek, Side?
items.a: Competition and traffic are very high in these regions. A slow or complicated site will cause the guest to switch to another hotel within seconds. Performance and smooth booking flow are critical, especially for mobile users.

items.q: What is your web & software approach for corporate brands other than tourism?
items.a:
• Clear description of products and services
  • Correct presentation of corporate reputation and references
  • B2B lead collection processes (form, demo, appointment)
are the focus. Web infrastructure becomes a tool actively used by sales and marketing teams.

items.q: How should the web & software infrastructure comply with KVKK and other regulations in Turkey?
items.a: Form and data collection processes, cookie management, logging, retention periods and access authorizations must be designed to comply with the relevant legislation. This is not only a legal requirement, but also a sign of trust towards the guest and customer.

items.q: Do you have integration experience with PMS-OTA and reservation solutions used in Turkey?
items.a: Yes. Experience in working with different PMS, channel managers and reservation engines ensures faster and safer integration processes. As the project begins, it is clarified which providers you are working with and an integration plan is made accordingly.

items.q: What is website development?
items.a: It is the design and coding of a high-performance and manageable web infrastructure designed according to the needs of your brand.

items.q: Is using ready-made themes always bad?
items.a: Not always; However, it often brings unnecessary code and plugin overhead and creates performance and flexibility problems.

items.q: Is it enough to just make desktop-oriented design?
items.a: No; traffic largely comes from mobile. A mobile-first approach is required.

items.q: Is it enough to just change the server to increase site speed?
items.a: No. Code, visual, cache, third party scripts and infrastructure should be considered as a whole.

items.q: Is it a problem to leave the administration panel in English?
items.a: Yes, if it increases the difficulty of use and the risk of errors for your teams; The panel language should be easy for your users to use.

items.q: Is it enough to just change the visual design on an old site?
items.a: Sometimes a design refresh is beneficial; But if infrastructure problems continue, the changes remain at a cosmetic level.

items.q: Do I have to finish everything on the first launch of the web project?
items.a: No. It is often more manageable and healthier to launch with critical modules and move forward by dividing the rest into phases.

items.a: This call; Rather than discussing ready-made package prices, it means discussing a customized architecture based on your existing infrastructure, integration needs and business goals. This meeting is a critical start, especially in hotel and integrated system projects.

meta.title: Creative & Design Services FAQ – Brand Communication and Design Processes Guide | DGTLFACE
meta.description: Frequently asked questions about Creative & Design Services; graphic design, video production, campaign creatives and brand identity. You can find DGTLFACE's professional approach focused on hotel and tourism on this FAQ page.
meta.focusTopics: graphic design, video production, campaign creatives, brand identity, hotel & tourism scenarios, common mistakes, optimization tips

items.q: What are creative & design services?
items.a: Creative & design services; It covers all creative work done to accurately tell the brand's story, products and experience visually and audibly. Graphic design, motion, video, photography, campaign creatives and brand identity; are the basic components of this service. The aim is to give the brand a noticeable, memorable and consistent appearance.

items.q: What exactly does a creative agency do?
items.a:
Creative agency;
  • Analyzes the brand and target audience,
  • Produces concept and campaign ideas,
  • Plans and manages graphic and video production processes,
  • Designs visual/text combinations to be used in social media, web and offline areas,
  • Analyzes and optimizes the results.
DGTLFACE does this by integrating with the digital performance layer, especially in hotel and tourism-oriented projects.

items.q: Why is professional creative & design support needed?
items.a:
Because not everything that seems "beautiful" is true. Professional support ensures
  • the visual language suitable for your brand,
  • the message tone compatible with the target audience,
  • social media, web and advertising formats,
  • the most effective use of your budget
. Powerful creatives can increase engagement per impression by up to 2x with the same media budget.

items.q: Are creative & design services only for big brands?
items.a: No. Professional creative support even for medium-sized brands, especially in areas of intense competition such as tourism, health, education and lifestyle; It is very valuable in terms of "being noticed in the crowd". As scale grows, brand identity and consistency become more critical.

items.q: What is the difference between creative & design and social media management?
items.a: Social media management; Focuses on strategy, planning, community and content flow. Creative & design; It deepens the visual/video and creative production part of this flow. The healthiest model; It is the creation of social media strategy and creative production in a single pot. (→ /Services/smm)

items.q: What does creative & design work for hotels bring?
items.a:
The right creatives in hotel projects;
  • reflect the atmosphere and experience better,
  • strengthen the price-value perception,
  • clarify the destination and concept,
  • provide higher interaction and click rates in social media and advertising campaigns,
  • add trust and attraction to the direct booking side.

items.q: What is the relationship between creative & design and brand identity?
items.a: Brand identity (logo, color palette, typography, visual style); It is the backbone of creative work. Creative & design processes convey this identity consistently across all formats (social media, web, video, print, etc.). If the identity isn't strong, creative materials will look messy and ineffective.

items.q: Is the creative & design service only for digital or does it also include print materials?
items.a:
According to the project scope; Social media, web and digital advertisements as well as
  • brochures, catalogues, posters,
  • fair and event materials,
  • corporate presentations,
  • corporate gift and package designs
can also fall within the scope of creative & design. (→ Corporate gift design )

items.q: Does it make more sense to produce only “one-off creative” or to become a long-term creative partnership?
items.a: One-off jobs (campaign, launch, etc.) are possible; However, if you want to establish a consistent visual world for the brand and maintain it in the long term, the creative partnership model is healthier. In this model, every campaign and design is based on the same brandbook and strategy.

items.q: How do creative & design services fit into my budget?
items.a:
By prioritizing:
  • Which channels are the most critical?
  • Which formats (video, static, motion) generate more business?
  • Which campaigns repeat more frequently?
A "creative investment map" is created according to the questions. Thus, the budget is directed to the highest impact areas.

items.q: What are creative & design services, in short?
items.a: It is the professional planning, design and production of all visual and audio communication materials of your brand.

items.q: Where should I start with promotional images and videos for my hotel?
items.a: First, clarify your concept, target markets and priority services; Shooting plan and creative storyboard should be prepared accordingly.

items.q: Why is brand identity design important?
items.a: Since brand identity is the skeleton on which all creatives are built; It gives a consistent, professional and distinctive appearance.

items.q: Does it make sense to outsource social media creative to the agency?
items.a: Yes; Getting the content idea from you and the design and production from the professional team often optimizes both time and quality.

items.q: Are creative & design services only for digital?
items.a: No; Printing, event, fair materials and corporate documents may also be within the scope.

items.q: How soon will I see a "difference" with creative & design work?
items.a: Usually within the first 1-3 months; Clear signals begin to appear in interaction, feedback and brand perception.

section3.title: Scope of Service: Graphic Design, Video and Brand Identity

items.q: What does your creative & design service package include?
items.a:
Depending on the project and need;
  • Graphic and motion design,
  • Social media and digital advertising creatives,
  • Web & UI/UX design,
  • Video production and editing,
  • Event and launch creatives,
  • Brand identity and brandbook works,
  • Corporate gift and promotional designs
may be within the scope. (→ /tr/creative-ve-design, /Services/creative/graphicDesign, /tr/creative/video-production, /tr/creative/ui-ux-design)

items.q: What do you do on the graphic design side?
items.a:
• Designs compatible with your corporate identity are produced in areas such as logo and sub-brand works,
  • Social media post and story designs,
  • banner and digital advertising images,
  • corporate documents (brochure, presentation, catalogue),
  • fair and event materials
.

items.q: How does the video production process work?
items.a:
General flow:
  1. Clarification of brief and objectives,
  2. Concept and storyboard study,
  3. Shooting plan and production,
  4. Editing, color, sound/music and subtitle studies,
  5. Preparation of versions suitable for different platforms (Reels, YouTube, TV, etc.).
(→ Creative & video production → , Event production → /tr/creative/eventlik-)

items.q: What does your UI/UX design service include?
items.a:
In web and application interfaces;
  • user journey,
  • wireframe and prototypes,
  • visual interface design,
  • component library,
  • responsive and mobile-oriented design
are presented. The aim is to produce interfaces that are both aesthetic and usable. (→ /tr/creative/ui-ux-design)

items.q: How long does brand identity / brandbook work take?
items.a:
• Basic identity (logo, color, typography, usage rules): 3–6 weeks,
  • Comprehensive brandbook (photography style, iconography, social media guideline, tone of voice, etc.): 6–10 weeks.

items.q: How do you build a bridge between creative & design services and social media designs?
items.a: Visual and language rules from Brandbook; It is applied to all content types (post, story, Reels covers, highlight styles, etc.) to be shared on social media. Thus, the user feels the same identity wherever he sees the brand.

items.q: Why is motion design important?
items.a: In the digital world, moving content (motion, short animations, Reels/TikTok videos) produces higher interaction than static images. Motion design makes your brand look more dynamic, modern and eye-catching; It provides a great advantage, especially in campaign and announcement content.

items.q: Should the creative team also design corporate gifts and promotions?
items.a: Yes; corporate gifts need to be consistent with the brand identity and truly valuable to the user. Instead of randomly selected gifts unrelated to the brand; Usable products designed by the creative team, bearing the identity, make a much stronger impression.

items.q: What do you analyze before starting the creative & design process?
items.a:
• Performance of existing creatives (social media, web, advertising),
  • Brand identity and existing guidelines,
  • Target audience and markets,
  • Channels and formats used,
  • Results of previous campaigns
are analyzed. Then, creative strategy and prioritization are made accordingly.

items.q: How is the monthly creative process progressing?
items.a:
General flow:
  1. Collecting monthly or campaign-based briefs,
  2. Backlog and calendar planning,
  3. Preparation of drafts and moodboards,
  4. Design/video production,
  5. Revision and approval processes,
  6. Delivery and implementation (social media, web, advertising, print, etc.).

items.q: How do you manage revision processes?
items.a:
Brief clarity and use of examples/moodboards are the main keys to reducing the number of revisions. At the beginning of the project;
  • the maximum revision round,
  • the time to be allocated for revision,
  • who will give approval
are clarified. Thus, cost and timeline are kept under control.

items.q: How do we share creative production with our internal team?
items.a:
• Internal team: Quick content ideas, brand insight, photos/videos from the field, topics to be written,
  • DGLFACE: Takes the role of creative idea, design, editing, storyboard, adaptation and production
. This hybrid model both speeds up work and improves quality.

items.q: Do you design separately for different channels (web, social media, advertising, print)?
items.a:
Although the basic concept and visual language are the same, the content is adapted specifically for the channel, as the format, ratio and purpose of use of each channel are different. For example;
  • web banner,
  • Instagram square post,
  • story format,
  • vertical video,
  • print brochure
gives the same message but its form is different.

items.q: How is delivery priority determined in creative & design projects?
items.a:
Priority is determined according to business goals:
  • The nearest campaign / launch,
  • Mandatory and repetitive materials (e.g. social media post templates),
  • Basic documents bearing the brand identity
are delivered with priority. Less critical productions can be taken into the second phase.

items.q: Who should have “final approval” in the creative & design process?
items.a: There should also be one or two people internal to the brand who know both communication and brand identity. When too many people are involved in approval, the process takes longer and creative quality often drifts towards the “riskiest but most boring” option.

items.q: Do powerful creatives really increase performance?
items.a:
Yes. With the same budget, it is possible to increase:
  • engagement rate,
  • click-through rate (CTR),
  • number of saves/shares
by up to two times, just by improving the creatives. Especially in sectors where visuality is critical, such as hotels and tourism, creative quality is directly reflected in performance.

items.q: What does wrong creative choice lead to?
items.a:
• It results in wrong guest/profile perception,
  • low interaction,
  • advertising budget being spent on “visible” visuals,
  • blurring of brand identity
. In the long run, the brand may lose its place in memory.

items.q: Is it normal to constantly revise?
items.a:
A certain level of revision is normal; However, returning constantly is usually due to:
  • weak/incomplete brief,
  • unclear brand identity,
  • lack of examples and references
. Clarifying these areas at the beginning of the project significantly reduces revision cycles.

items.q: What could be the problem with creatives who put a lot of effort but do not receive interaction?
items.a:
• Factors such as wrong platform,
  • wrong format,
  • too much text or wrong message,
  • irrelevant topic for the target audience,
  • inappropriate broadcast time
may be effective. “A lot of effort = a lot of results” is not always true; The right message in the right place is more important.

items.q: What will designs that do not match the brand identity lead to in the long run?
items.a:
Even if it is not noticed in the short term, in the long term it causes:
  • users not being able to "recognize" the brand,
  • loss of trust,
  • deterioration of price-value perception in brands with premium perception
. Design trends are followed, but brand identity does not change at the same pace as each trend.

items.q: I feel like my creative & design budget is going down the drain; what should I do?
items.a:
First, it is necessary to prepare a creative performance report showing which creative
  • was used where,
  • what results it produced,
  • at what cost
. Then a new plan is made, focusing on the formats and topics that generate the most business.

items.q: Is just producing creative for social media enough?
items.a: No. Web, advertising, email, in-hotel materials and other touchpoints should also be supported creatively. Social media; This is an important but not sufficient part of the whole.

items.q: How do creative & design improvements impact the performance of other channels?
items.a:
Good creatives increase the performance of the entire digital ecosystem by offering
  • higher CTR and lower click cost in advertising campaigns,
  • higher interaction and saves on social media,
  • a clearer and more convincing visual story on the web
.

section6.title: Productive Search & Industry-Focused Creative Questions

items.q: What is your creative approach for hotel and tourism brands across Türkiye?
items.a: In hotel and tourism brands in Turkey; destination, concept and target markets are considered together. Since the guest profiles and expectations of different regions such as Antalya coasts, Aegean and Cappadocia change, creative tone and content themes are adapted according to the region.

items.q: How to get out of the "sea-sand-sun" cliché?
items.a:
By focusing on the real story of the hotel:
  • experience and guest stories,
  • gastronomy, spa, activities,
  • specific content for segments such as families with children, couples, adults-only
a more "people-oriented" language is established. In this way, a brand-specific visual world is created, instead of the visuals that everyone uses.

items.q: What are the creative & design priorities for city hotels?
items.a:
In city hotels;
  • business travel, meetings, events,
  • location advantage,
  • corporate services
come to the fore. In creatives; The emphasis is on “function and convenience” rather than room. Meeting areas, lobbies, work areas and ease of transportation are at the forefront in videos and visuals.

items.q: What is your creative & design approach for corporate brands in Turkey?
items.a:
In corporate projects;
  • trust and professionalism,
  • sector expertise,
  • references and success stories
become more critical. Designs; While carrying a simple, clear and corporate language, the brand identity is not compromised.

items.q: What role does creative & design play in the narrative of destination and location?
items.a: Especially in tourism; The story of the destination creates a stronger impact when told together with the story of the hotel. In photo and video productions; With shots outside the hotel (beach, city center, nature, events), the feeling of "I should be there" is created in the guest's mind.

items.q: Are creative & design services just for “aesthetics”?
items.a: No; Performance and alignment with brand strategy are as important as aesthetics.

items.q: Should all creatives have the same style?
items.a: It should carry the same identity, but flexible sub-styles can be used for different campaigns.

items.q: Is just using stock images enough?
items.a: Stock images can help; However, going completely stock makes the brand look ordinary and copycat.

items.q: Is video a must for every campaign?
items.a: Not necessarily; but video significantly increases impact in many campaigns.

items.q: Must the logo be visible on all creative?
items.a: Generally yes; However, strong brand elements can be used instead of logos in minimal or teaser works.

items.q: Do we have to constantly follow design trends?
items.a: It is important to know the trends, but it is not necessary to implement every trend; brand identity should be the main reference.

items.q: Does it make sense to get creative services only for social media creatives?
items.a: Yes; This is a very common pattern, especially for brands that focus on social media.

items.q: Can I also receive creative & design services as a short consultancy project?
items.a: Yes. Projects that only include “creative audit + roadmap + sample templates” can also be done; Your teams can undertake the implementation.

items.q: In creative & design work, is production or ideas more important?
items.a: Both are important; A bad idea does not shine with good production, and a good idea disappears with bad production.

items.q: How often should this Creative FAQ content be updated?
items.a: When visual trends, social media formats, video consumption habits or DGTLFACE's creative service model change; It should be reviewed at least every 180 days.

It is the first step to discuss a brand-specific solution instead of a ready-made package.
